ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Component_group_assignment is the relationship between an
and the
to which it is assigned. A Component_group_assignment is an incomplete concept by itself and is intended for use with a
or a .

specifies the
for the Component_group_assignment.
specifies the role of the for the Component_group_assignment.

A Component_placement_restriction_assignment is the relationship between the area or volume of an entire
or a portion thereof and restrictions to placement of other components in that area or volume due to an item in the design. The context of a Component_placement_restriction_assignment is the design of the assembly within which both the
and associated components are identified. The inclusion of this Application Object in a design model is a statement that a specific requirement exists for a specific subset of the point domain in the geometric context in the physical design. If there are unrestricted regions in the design, there is no need to populate a Component_placement_restriction_assignment to specify that. Industry practice is common to include one overall Component_placement_restriction_assignment to indicate the extent of the interconnect design but this standard does not require that.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
for which the Component_placement_restriction_assignment is made. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The mounting_clearance relates to the distance between the bottom of the component body and the substrate onto which the component is assembled. It does not refer to the component terminals.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies whether or not there is a restriction upon placement of components in an area or volume for the Component_placement_restriction_assignment. The value of TRUE states that components are permitted only within the equivalent volume specified either by the volume directly or by the area and associated parameters; the value of FALSE states that components are not permitted to be placed in the defined area or volume. The inclusion of this Application Object in a design model is a statement that a specific requirement exists for a specific subset of the point domain in the geometric context in the physical design. The components_permitted shall cause the Component_placement_restriction_assignment to be in the role of keepin when the value is TRUE and Component_placement_restriction_assignment to be in the role of keepout when the value is FALSE.

specifies the role of the
for the Component_placement_restriction_assignment.

specifies the role of the
for the Component_placement_restriction_assignment. The volume is in the context of the assembly. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the role of the
for the Component_placement_restriction_assignment. The area is an area on an . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
specifies the largest
in the positive direction from the , for which the Component_placement_restriction_assignment is made. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: An example of the maximum_positive_component_height attribute is a printed circuit assembly where the maximum component height in the positive direction relative to a datum is given. This dimension pertains to the fit of the printed circuit assembly in its next assembly. That dimension is the maximum_positive_component_height.

ext_description.p:
specifies the largest
in the negative direction from that , for which the Component_placement_restriction_assignment is made. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: An example of the maximum_negative_component_height attribute is a printed circuit assembly with through-hole components, where the maximum lead protrusion dimension is given. That dimension is the maximum_negative_component_height. Another example of the maximum_negative_component_height attribute is a printed circuit assembly with surface mounted components on both sides. The maximum_negative_component_height attribute is the distance between the established datum and the maximum material condition of the vertical dimension of the highest surface mount component on the secondary side of the printed circuit assembly.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: At least one of area or volume shall be provided.

The direction of negative measurement is antiparallel to the normal of the surface of the
specified by area..

The direction of positive measurement is parallel to the normal of the surface of the
specified by area..

The location of the
for the mounting_clearance shall be on the same side of the
as that specified by area..

ext_description.p: An Item_restricted_requirement is a type of . The Item_restricted_requirement provides the ability for a design organization to track the dependency of a requirement on a specific design object.
ext_description.example: Thermal requirements may, for example, be dependent on the processor module or the drive motor.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Item_restricted_requirement. The basis is the reference design object for the requirement.
A member of Item_restricted_requirement shall not reference itself with the basis attribute.

A Mounting_restriction_area is a type of . A Mounting_restriction_area is the region on an where mounting restrictions for components exist. The shape representing the mounting restriction region shall have an origin that is congruent with the origin of the shape representing the . This congruency shall be accomplished using concepts equivalent to the Application objects or . The shape representing the Mounting_restriction_area is itself in the shape of the assembly, as is the shape of the . The congruency requirement is established so that an application interface can unambiguously import the Mounting_restriction_area into a CAD layout tool. Mounting_restriction_area is part of a design requirement for an interconnect that is established in the assembly or assemblies in which the interconnect is used.
specifies the role of the for the Mounting_restriction_area.

specifies the role of the for the Mounting_restriction_area. The type of surface is determined by the definition of the specified by mounting_surface. The mounting_surface conveys design intent to identify the component that implements the connectivity prescribed by the relevant member of .

ext_description.p: If inherited from is provided, then it shall be a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Mounting_restriction_volume is a type of . A Mounting_restriction_volume is the region on an
where mounting restrictions for components exist. The shape representing the mounting restriction region shall have an origin that is congruent with the origin of the shape representing the . This congruency shall be accomplished using concepts equivalent to the Application objects
or . The shape representing the Mounting_restriction_volume is itself in the shape of the assembly, as is the shape of the . The congruency requirement is established so that an application interface can unambiguously import the Mounting_restriction_volume into a CAD layout tool. Mounting_restriction_volume is part of a design requirement for an interconnect that is established in the assembly or assemblies in which the interconnect is used.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Mounting_restriction_volume is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Mounting_restriction_volume as its .

specifies the role of the
for the Mounting_restriction_volume.

specifies the role of the
for the Mounting_restriction_volume. The type of surface is determined by the definition of the
specified by mounting_surface. The mounting_surface conveys design intent to identify the component that implements the connectivity prescribed by the relevant member of .

ext_description.p:
A Placement_group_requirement_definition is a type of . A Placement_group_requirement_definition is a group composed of
that are associated with each other for this purpose by the , in order to meet some specific placement requirement. The placement is assigned through the
object, and does not indicate the explicit geometric relationship of the s to each other, only that they are all to be placed within an area.
ext_description.example: An example of a Placement_group_requirement_definition is the collection of s necessary to satisfy the functional requirement for a power supply.
An example of a Placement_group_requirement_definition is the collection of s necessary to satisfy the functional requirement for a digital signal processor.

An example of a Placement_group_requirement_definition is the collection of s with a case temperature greater than 55 degrees Centigrade. The associated area would be a rectangle all of whose inner points are within 6 cm of the cooling unit.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the name of the Placement_group_requirement_definition.

a derived attribute that collects the associated
in the role
with the
'derived from'.

specifies the role of the
for the Placement_group_requirement_definition.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Placement_group_requirement_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Placement_group_requirement_definition as its .
the requirement shall exist and it's size shall be at least one.

The
shall not be populated.
A Placement_group_area_assignment is the relationship between a and the on the interconnect substrate instance to which it is restricted.
specifies the role of the for the Placement_group_area_assignment.
specifies the role of the for the Placement_group_area_assignment.
A Placement_group_volume_assignment is the relationship between a and the on the interconnect substrate instance to which it is restricted.
specifies the role of the for the Placement_group_volume_assignment.
specifies the role of the for the Placement_group_volume_assignment.
An assembly_spacing_type lists the types of the spacing.
specifies that spacing is measured between nearest boundaries of the design items indicated;
specifies that spacing is measured between centroids of the design items indicated;
specifies that spacing is measured between furthest boundaries of the design items indicated;
An assembly_product_design_object_category lists the categories of the assembly product design object.
specifies that an instance that in this category is an implementation of the assembly component;
specifies that an instance that in this category is an implementation of the assembly module component;
specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the assembly module component terminal;
specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the assembly module macro component;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the conductive interconnect element with pre defined transitions;
specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the conductive interconnect element with user defined single transition;
specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the connected area component;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the cutout;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the dielectric material passage;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the fiducial;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the interconnect module macro component join terminal;

specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the interface access stratum feature template component;
specifies that an instance that is in this category is an implementation of the interface component;

An Assembly_group_spacing_requirement is a type of . An Assembly_group_spacing_requirement specifies the spacing between groups of components in an assembly rather than between individual components.

specifies one role of the
for the Assembly_group_spacing_requirement.

specifies one role of the
for the Assembly_group_spacing_requirement.

an attribute inherited from the
supertype that specifies the role of the
for the Assembly_group_spacing_requirement.

specifies the
for the Assembly_group_spacing_requirement. The of_spacing_type is either a centroid, a nearest_boundary, or a furthest_boundary for the Assembly_group_spacing_requirement.

An Assembly_spacing_requirement is a type of
that describes the physical spacing between categories of design objects assembly_module_assembly_component, an assembly_module_component_feature, an interconnect_module_cutout, an interconnect_module_fill_area, an interconnect_module_design_intent_modification, an interconnect_module_inter_stratum_feature, an interconnect_module_cutout_edge_segment, an interconnect_module_interconnect_module_edge, an interconnect_module_interconnect_module_edge_segment, an interconnect_module_plated_cutout, an interconnect_module_plated_cutout_edge_segment, an interconnect_module_plated_interconnect_module_edge, an interconnect_module_plated_interconnect_module_edge_segment, an interconnect_module_plated_passage, a category consisting of the union of an interconnect_module_plated_passage category and an interconnect_module_plated_unsupported_passage category, an interconnect_module_unsupported_passage, an interconnect_module_stratum_feature, or an interconnect_module_via, and another of these categories of design objects or additionally a group. Members of Application objects are considered to be in the category associated with the Application object. A group is provided to support the case where finer granularity is required than just the complete category.
The category assembly_module_component_feature is a category that all members of
in the context of assembly design shall belong to.
If only some of the Component_features are to be constrained, a group would be established against which the spacing requirements would be levied, and members of the Application object would be explicitly assigned to the group.

specifies the role of the
for the Assembly_spacing_requirement.

specifies the role of the
for the Assembly_spacing_requirement.

an attribute inherited from the
supertype that specifies the role of the
for the Assembly_spacing_requirement.

specifies the role of the
for the Assembly_spacing_requirement. The of_spacing_type is either a centroid, a nearest_boundary, or a furthest_boundary for the Assembly_spacing_requirement.

The get_acpr_rvd function returns the set of
that are referenced by a given set of s in the role .
the specified set of .
